intro: Piperia candida, commonly known as the white piperia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant features slender, hollow stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white, often clustered in spherical heads, giving it a subtle and elegant appearance. While not widely cultivated for food, it is of interest to botanists and gardeners for its unique morphology and ecological role.
